content:
Build-Status.docx

This was working on Thursday morning with version 1.1.8 of the Publisher --
I don't think it's a publisher issue, it's a template change. But I don't understand why Trifolia is failing. Does it run outside Trifolia @Robert Dieterle ?
have not tried -- was concerned that I would break the only "clean" build
The code in GitHub has not been updated since Thursday morning -- I guess I could force a build if that would help
problem is that I do the build in Trifolia with nearly every change and only push to GitHub when all changes are ready
@Lloyd McKenzie I'm not sure what you're looking for when you say 'run outside trifolia'?
If you push stuff to Git and it doesn't build, that won't remove the CI publication from your last successful publication. (@Grahame Grieve I mean try it locally on your machine or try it in Git)
I know that you meant that, but a standard trifolia user won't know how to do that, and I'm not sure what you think it will achieve.
I'm just wondering if it's a Trifolia issue or something with the IG.
Pushing it to Git is probably best because then I can debug
I do not have a setup on my machine . If I change GitHub before Lynn pull the ballot version wont that be a problem if it does not build? We are at the very edge of my understanding of the process.
Again -- I have not made any change in the IG since Thursday morning when it was building just fine in Trifilia and on the CI.
@Sean McIlvenna trifolia should have a clearly documented process for this. Neither Lloyd or I know how to advise a trifolia user to debug like this
and the problem for Lloyd and I is that you haven't identified the IG

sorry PostAcuteOrderExcahnge
CI build Package hl7.fhir.us.dme-orders#0.2.2
One day I will learn to spell PostAcuteOrdersExchange in Trifolia , dme-orders in GitHub
@Lloyd McKenzie you can reproduce it with what is in ci-build
irrespective of what the problem is, it should not stop the build
I have submitted a "ticket to Lantana regarding the issue. Perhaps they can help. As to documentation about a problem like this ....
I can export the IG from trifolia and update GitHub. I assume if it fails, I can just update with the version from Thursday (saved the files on my machine). I this what you recommend?
Working to debug
